snippet: Financial police seized 1.8 billion euros, or $2.35 billion, from Nomura’s Italian unit in an inquiry into whether it helped Monte dei Paschi di Siena hide huge losses.
abstract: Italian officials broaden their investigating into whether Japanese investment bank Nomura helped hide losses at troubled lender Monte dei Paschi di Sienna; order the police to seize 1.8 billion euros, or $2.35 billion, in assets and name Normura's former top European executive, Sadeq Sayeed, as a suspect.
